marklogic.body: Up until recently the only Wonder Woman stories I had ever read were some of her appearances in Justice League and Batman comics. I've Always been interested in her as a character, but with only so much cash available each month, I usually stuck to the Bat family books since I've loved that group since i was a child. So the rebooted Wonder Woman series seemed like the perfect time to jump on board with this character and I've really enjoyed it. There were a couple of "hmm?" moments, but for the most part it was an interesting story with beautiful artwork. I really loved that Diana's world was so different than what I've been used to with the Gotham books (gods and such). Now, I read this latest issue and find out that WW comes from a world that is more vicious and Cold-blooded than I ever imagined. Part of me was disappointed in this development, but then Diana appears to be just as shocked as us readers. I was interested to see how this was going to develop over the next couple of issues. Then I started finding out more about her pre-reboot story. The only new child from an island of immortal warriors? A clay baby instead of an immortal-god offspring? I can't believe that the creative team had the option of tweaking those cool ideas, but went in the direction that they have gone. I'm no expert on WW so I don't feel the same betrayal and outrage that a lot of you other fans are experiencing.Â Though it is pretty crappy that they've made the Amazons into pseudo-black widows. I'm wondering if I should give this series one or two more issues to see how it plays out, or if I should just cancel it and start buying up her earlier books?
